HDG.LOG.content: a protection in which what lies before remains (bleibt) laid down: stored, laid away, secured & deposited in unconcealment (Unverborgenheit), sheltered in unconcealment > the keisthai of upokeimenon: presencing (Anwesen) of that which lies before us into unconcealment: legein concerns safety (Geborgenheit), safekeeping, gathering appropriate to such a laying [what about annihilation?], safety of that which comes together into presence (des beisammen-Anwesenden)
HDG.LOG.linkedContent: a protection in which what lies before remains (bleibt) laid down: stored, laid away, secured & deposited in unconcealment (Unverborgenheit), sheltered in unconcealment > the keisthai of upokeimenon: presencing (Anwesen) of that which lies before us into unconcealment: legein concerns safety (Geborgenheit), safekeeping, gathering appropriate to such a laying [what about annihilation?], safety of that which comes together into presence (des beisammen-Anwesenden)

HDG.BC.content: guidewords not propositions passed around as assertions “about” a “philosophical standpoint”: treated as such they’d miss the essential [Heidegger beyond Heidegger] > this reflection doesn’t have to cling to phrasing of what’s said here > main point: notice something neglected, notice it w/out haste [slow down], don’t seek its utility or purpose; have courage to recognize what holds sway (waltet) in domain of ontological difference [differance?]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: guidewords not propositions passed around as assertions “about” a “philosophical standpoint”: treated as such they’d miss the essential [Heidegger beyond Heidegger] > this reflection doesn’t have to cling to phrasing of what’s said here > main point: notice something neglected, notice it w/out haste [slow down], don’t seek its utility or purpose; have courage to recognize what holds sway (waltet) in domain of ontological difference [differance?]

HDG.BC.content: [slow down] no way out in any direction: Being cast itself toward us—in saying something about Being, we cast it away > perceive the impasse into which Being places us as a sign pointing toward where we already are placed, since we comport ourselves toward beings [presuppositions? also, what is a sign if you already know its parent?] [rather than impasse as aporia: impasse is what it is] > concealed abode, to which essence of our history owes its origin, abode that concerns our essence
HDG.BC.linkedContent: [slow down] no way out in any direction: Being cast itself toward us—in saying something about Being, we cast it away > perceive the impasse into which Being places us as a sign pointing toward where we already are placed, since we comport ourselves toward beings [presuppositions? also, what is a sign if you already know its parent?] [rather than impasse as aporia: impasse is what it is] > concealed abode, to which essence of our history owes its origin, abode that concerns our essence

HDG.BC.content: becoming aware of our essential abode in Being: 1st remembrance, impulse to preparation, attending to preparation, preparation for this readiness, readiness for such a change, transformation of humanity re: relation to Being, grasping ground > all this remains preliminary, the preliminary (das Vor-läufige) also an extending-in-advance (ein Voraus-laufen) into a future of history > only initiating/incipient pertains to the future, what is present always is past [slow down] > no haste in incipient, only incipient if it can rest in itself (in sich selbst zu ruhen vermag) [causa sui?], never comes too late, at best too early [Nietzsche]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: becoming aware of our essential abode in Being: 1st remembrance, impulse to preparation, attending to preparation, preparation for this readiness, readiness for such a change, transformation of humanity re: relation to Being, grasping ground > all this remains preliminary, the preliminary (das Vor-läufige) also an extending-in-advance (ein Voraus-laufen) into a future of history > only initiating/incipient pertains to the future, what is present always is past [slow down] > no haste in incipient, only incipient if it can rest in itself (in sich selbst zu ruhen vermag) [causa sui?], never comes too late, at best too early [Nietzsche]

HDG.BT.content: Dasein falls prey to tradition, which keeps it from providing its own guidance > tradition takes what has come down to us, delivers it to self-evidence, blocks access to primordial ‘sources’ of categories/concepts
HDG.BT.linkedContent: Dasein falls prey to tradition, which keeps it from providing its own guidance > tradition takes what has come down to us, delivers it to self-evidence, blocks access to primordial ‘sources’ of categories/concepts

HDG.CCP.content: night slows us down, leaves us time to meditate > still far from human habitation [Aristotle] > “ever more openly I am coming to trust in the inconspicuous guide who takes us by the hand” > unaccustomed task, difficult
HDG.CCP.linkedContent: night slows us down, leaves us time to meditate > still far from human habitation [Aristotle] > “ever more openly I am coming to trust in the inconspicuous guide who takes us by the hand” > unaccustomed task, difficult

HDG.CCP.content: waiting has become clearer to me now, all become more waitful along our path [our experience?] > don’t pin me down to particular words, move freely in realm of words: word does not, never can re-present anything, it signifies (shows something abiding in range of its expressibility) > I tried to release myself [effort] into Gegnet > into Gelassenheit > “we can hardly come to releasement more fittingly than through an occasion of letting ourselves in [to waiting]” [p. 70 like the occasion of the silent course of a conversation]
HDG.CCP.linkedContent: waiting has become clearer to me now, all become more waitful along our path [our experience?] > don’t pin me down to particular words, move freely in realm of words: word does not, never can re-present anything, it signifies (shows something abiding in range of its expressibility) > I tried to release myself [effort] into Gegnet > into Gelassenheit > “we can hardly come to releasement more fittingly than through an occasion of letting ourselves in [to waiting]” [p. 70 like the occasion of the silent course of a conversation]

HDG.DL.content: Winke brauchen den weitesten Schwingungsbereich [hints, traces, need/use the widest swinging realm], where mortals go back-forth slowly, “hesitate (zögern),” done truly when slowness (Langsame) rests (getragen) on shy reverence (die Scheu)
HDG.DL.linkedContent: Winke brauchen den weitesten Schwingungsbereich [hints, traces, need/use the widest swinging realm], where mortals go back-forth slowly, “hesitate (zögern),” done truly when slowness (Langsame) rests (getragen) on shy reverence (die Scheu)

HDG.DL.content: in Japanese, mystery is a mystery when it doesn’t come out that mystery is at work (waltet) [reigns?] [those in a hurry will never notice, slow down] > to guard purity of mystery’s wellspring, hardest of all > but we must incessantly strive to speak about (über) language, though almost (fast) inevitably such speaking turns language into an object (Gegenstand) > p. 51 that would be a position above language, wouldn’t hear from it, would only speak from language
HDG.DL.linkedContent: in Japanese, mystery is a mystery when it doesn’t come out that mystery is at work (waltet) [reigns?] [those in a hurry will never notice, slow down] > to guard purity of mystery’s wellspring, hardest of all > but we must incessantly strive to speak about (über) language, though almost (fast) inevitably such speaking turns language into an object (Gegenstand) > p. 51 that would be a position above language, wouldn’t hear from it, would only speak from language

HDG.LP.content: “so quiet” appears again and again in Trakl, quiet (leise) means slow (langam) > night, blue game, shy, gentle sheaf: “the sheaf of blueness gathers the depth (Tiefe) of the holy in the depths (Grund) of its bond” > holy withholds in withdrawing > Es [the holy] verschenkt seine Ankunft [bestows its arrival], indem es sich in den verhaltenden Entzug verwahrt [while/by guarding itself in its withholding withdrawal]
HDG.LP.linkedContent: “so quiet” appears again and again in Trakl, quiet (leise) means slow (langam) > night, blue game, shy, gentle sheaf: “the sheaf of blueness gathers the depth (Tiefe) of the holy in the depths (Grund) of its bond” > holy withholds in withdrawing > Es [the holy] verschenkt seine Ankunft [bestows its arrival], indem es sich in den verhaltenden Entzug verwahrt [while/by guarding itself in its withholding withdrawal]

HDG.LP.content: in Trakl’s “Seven-Song of Death,” death: the Untergang to which ein Fremdes is called [the going down of a stranger]
HDG.LP.linkedContent: in Trakl’s “Seven-Song of Death,” death: the Untergang to which ein Fremdes is called [the going down of a stranger]

HDG.LP.content: when mortals follow something strange down, when called, they themselves enter (gelangen) strangeness, become strangers & solitary (Einsame)
HDG.LP.linkedContent: when mortals follow something strange down, when called, they themselves enter (gelangen) strangeness, become strangers & solitary (Einsame)

HDG.LP.content: in Trakl, “the boy’s blue voice retrieves (zurückholt) something forgotten and fore-tells (vorsagt) it” [cf. youth in Evening Conversations] [p. 178 earliness of long since dead promises “springtime of the soul”]> the boy? Elis, the stranger called to go under (Elis different from Trakl, like Zarathustra different from Nietzsche) > Elis goes down into uralte Frühe, older than decomposing Geschlecht, older because more mindful (sinnender), more mindful because more still, more still because self-stilling > boy Elis shelters/stores gentle two-fold of sex [sexual difference not in discord of duality]
HDG.LP.linkedContent: in Trakl, “the boy’s blue voice retrieves (zurückholt) something forgotten and fore-tells (vorsagt) it” [cf. youth in Evening Conversations] [p. 178 earliness of long since dead promises “springtime of the soul”]> the boy? Elis, the stranger called to go under (Elis different from Trakl, like Zarathustra different from Nietzsche) > Elis goes down into uralte Frühe, older than decomposing Geschlecht, older because more mindful (sinnender), more mindful because more still, more still because self-stilling > boy Elis shelters/stores gentle two-fold of sex [sexual difference not in discord of duality]

HDG.WL.content: where does the showing spring (rührt) from? slow down, enough to heed (achten) what stirs/quickens (regt) in the showing, and bears this quickness out
HDG.WL.linkedContent: where does the showing spring (rührt) from? slow down, enough to heed (achten) what stirs/quickens (regt) in the showing, and bears this quickness out

HDG.EC.content: the unnecessary is most necessary of all, only one who has learned this understands pain of human barred from thinking > thinking is thus the unnecessary, and yet thinking has a high rank of honor: the highest > I know this but don’t know the Grund of this > as if Occident couldn’t wait until thinking finds its originary essence: perhaps pure waiting, ability to wait [slow down, hastiness (Übereilung) of thinking thought as ratio, rationality]
HDG.EC.linkedContent: the unnecessary is most necessary of all, only one who has learned this understands pain of human barred from thinking > thinking is thus the unnecessary, and yet thinking has a high rank of honor: the highest > I know this but don’t know the Grund of this > as if Occident couldn’t wait until thinking finds its originary essence: perhaps pure waiting, ability to wait [slow down, hastiness (Übereilung) of thinking thought as ratio, rationality]

HDG.EC.content: [facetiously?] what’s more necessary than “getting down to businesses with the given facts (Zupacken im Gegebenen), remaking what is present at hand, and moving forward w/ what has existed before (Vorwärtsbringen des Bisherigen)”? > that factual sense of reality (Tatsachensinn) lets man stand squarely on ground, validates, secures, effectuates (wirken), holds fast—and yet can’t be w/out the unnecessary (Unnötige)
HDG.EC.linkedContent: [facetiously?] what’s more necessary than “getting down to businesses with the given facts (Zupacken im Gegebenen), remaking what is present at hand, and moving forward w/ what has existed before (Vorwärtsbringen des Bisherigen)”? > that factual sense of reality (Tatsachensinn) lets man stand squarely on ground, validates, secures, effectuates (wirken), holds fast—and yet can’t be w/out the unnecessary (Unnötige)

HDG.EC.content: [Chinese philosophy] “human needs only enough space to be able to put his foot down” > but what use would be that standing if a crevice opened up to the underworld around it? [shortest shadow] > no more use > from this, necessity of unnecessary clearly apparent
HDG.EC.linkedContent: [Chinese philosophy] “human needs only enough space to be able to put his foot down” > but what use would be that standing if a crevice opened up to the underworld around it? [shortest shadow] > no more use > from this, necessity of unnecessary clearly apparent

HDG.OHF.content: all talking about hermeneutics misunderstands it, the wakefulness for facticity must temporalize/unfold “there” > hermeneutics [Heidegger admits to making a personal statement] not philosophy at all, something preliminary (Vorläufiges), has its own explanation (Bewandtnis) for being: what’s at issue in it, not to be finished quickly, rather to hold out in it as long as possible (möglichste lange darin auszuhalten) [slow down] > we’ve become so weak-kneed, pithless, can’t hold out in asking a qustion
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: all talking about hermeneutics misunderstands it, the wakefulness for facticity must temporalize/unfold “there” > hermeneutics [Heidegger admits to making a personal statement] not philosophy at all, something preliminary (Vorläufiges), has its own explanation (Bewandtnis) for being: what’s at issue in it, not to be finished quickly, rather to hold out in it as long as possible (möglichste lange darin auszuhalten) [slow down] > we’ve become so weak-kneed, pithless, can’t hold out in asking a qustion

HDG.OHF.content: [re: historical human sciences] [a pre-critique of Foucault?] each culture interrogated re: expressive being of its formation (Ausdruckseins ihrer Gebilde), on basis of its style, bringing into relief (Abhebung) the Gestaltcharaktere des Gestalthaften: morphology > one culture must be held up against another, method of universally comparing forms (Gestaltvergleichung) (homology, analogy, synchronism, parallelism) > “a closed form-endowed context (Zusammenhang) of forms”: totality of historical past explicated in such a way, a flattening down (Niederschlag) [translator frustratingly prefers word condensation here], can be mastered at a glance (in einem Blick), can order via charts/rubrics [classifying (Ordnung)]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [re: historical human sciences] [a pre-critique of Foucault?] each culture interrogated re: expressive being of its formation (Ausdruckseins ihrer Gebilde), on basis of its style, bringing into relief (Abhebung) the Gestaltcharaktere des Gestalthaften: morphology > one culture must be held up against another, method of universally comparing forms (Gestaltvergleichung) (homology, analogy, synchronism, parallelism) > “a closed form-endowed context (Zusammenhang) of forms”: totality of historical past explicated in such a way, a flattening down (Niederschlag) [translator frustratingly prefers word condensation here], can be mastered at a glance (in einem Blick), can order via charts/rubrics [classifying (Ordnung)]

HDG.OHF.content: [on destruction] fundamental historical critique > dismantling (Abbau) takes its departure from presentation of today’s situation > when tradition is critically dismantled, no longer get bogged down in seemingly important problems [arrival?]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [on destruction] fundamental historical critique > dismantling (Abbau) takes its departure from presentation of today’s situation > when tradition is critically dismantled, no longer get bogged down in seemingly important problems [arrival?]
